posts.name: Chadfrom7226
posts.cooked:
Has anyone used PhotonVision with CTRE Swerve (and AdvantageKit)? I would like to reference some code when developing ours.

The programming team is trying to get it working but we are a bit stuck and are unsure where to start. There’s no examples with the official CTRE github, nor on the photonvision examples github.

The docs are a bit confusing. This page Getting Target Data - PhotonVision Docs makes it look easy, but we dont know where to put it. Do we put it in another class? In robot.java? Do we run it on another thread?

I see that I can add vision measurements in Robot.java Phoenix6-Examples/java/SwerveWithPathPlanner/src/main/java/frc/robot/Robot.java at main · CrossTheRoadElec/Phoenix6-Examples · GitHub but I just want to make sure I am doing it properly, where I can log everything with AdvantageKit

Any help would be appreciated!

posts.name: Bryson Halsey
posts.cooked:
We currently are using the CTRE Swerve example from AdvatageKit and added in the Vision examples from their docs. It works out the of the box with PhotonVision, here is a link to our repo where we have the Vision implementation, happy to answer any questions you have!

First code for the 2025 Reefscape robot. Contribute to WHS-FRC-3467/Skip-5.15-Alpha development by creating an account on GitHub.

posts.name: Otto
posts.cooked: We’re using ctre swerve with an akit implementation based on 254s 2024 code. We added in a photonvision implementation with like 2 cameras, our codes here: GitHub - FRC-7525/Reefscape-7525 at Drive-Tuning . Generally you want to split up an apriltag vision system into its own subsystem (so into its own class) and then youre gona need more classes if youre using io layers for akit. Then in your superstructure class or robot.java (wherever u call drive periodic) you just add vision measurments to your drive subsystem with a getter in the vision subsystem for the measurments and then an addVisionMeasurment() function in your drive subsystem (should already be one there).

posts.name: Ashton A
posts.cooked: This season we are using CTRE Swerve with AdvantageKit, maple-sim, and PhotonVision. It’s mainly based on 254’s AdvantageKit code and the AdvantageKit vision template. Code is here: GitHub - UHDbits/CTREAKCombo: Combination of the CTRE swerve drive library with partial AdvantageKit support (no real replay modification). To be used in 2025, hopefully fully custom code in 2026.

link_counts.title: GitHub - UHDbits/CTREAKCombo: Combination of the CTRE swerve drive library with partial AdvantageKit support (no real replay modification). To be used in 2025, hopefully fully custom code in 2026.

posts.name: Daniel C.
posts.cooked:
AdvantageKit should provide a vision template that supports photonvision. They use a slightly different mechanism than the photonvision docs(to allow for more replayability).

Does your team know a lot about IO layers and what to put in them?

posts.name: Chadfrom7226
posts.cooked:
We didn’t use the IO layers last year we just did NT logging.  We didn’t really have time to figure it all out. I guess you could say we didn’t take full… Advantage… of it?

Thanks everyone for the suggestions to use the AdvantageKit templates. I looked into those and they seem like an excellent starting place. Seems like it’s exactly what we need

Kudos to AdvantageKit @jonahb55
